title: Flu jabs: everything you need to know including the best time to get a flu vaccination
text:
When it comes to the flu, prevention can be far better than treatment. Getting a flu jab isn’t quite as easy as ignoring your GP’s reminders, of course, but for many the alternative – fever, pains, coughing, and the threat of severe complications – is not worth the risk.

As the temperatures drop, it is especially important for ‘at risk’ individuals (ie those with a chronic condition or weakened immune system) to get a flu vaccination.

This can be done in two ways. Firstly, there’s the flu jab – an annual injection that contains inactivated flu viruses to protect your body from the active virus.
